summary:
This mod adds a little shack on a hilltop deep in the coldest regions of 
Skyrim between Solitude and Dawnstar.
descriptionHtml:
------------------------------------
Frostflake Top and retreat
------------------------------------

Outside:

- complete workplace with forge
- chopping block
- a lookout with cooking place
- a fantastic view to all sites and a warm campfire ;)
- (a smelter not far away)


Inside:

- alchemy and enchanting
- cooking place
- mannequin
- simple weapon rack
- several storages

To get a better impression, check out the reviews in the video section ! 

Installation
------------
Drag and drop the .esp file into the data folder
Backup your savegames and use at your own risk! 

The key is in a barrel around the house !

You can also download it from Steam if you prefer:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=128535492

Update
---------
- 0.96 added a snwoy roof (thanks reaper9111)
- 0.97 added chest to forge, added even more snow

Note
----
I made this mod because I was longtime looking for a little shack
deep in a snowy and freezing cold region of skyrim. I have tested a lot. 
But when I liked the houses, I mostly didn´t liked the places. But I wanted 
to start a new character and playing it out with the Frostfall - Hypothermia Mods as
a hunting / survival game. So I had to build my own one and also finally 
start to learn the creation kit basics.

So, this my first mod and and sadly, I could not figure out how to rework
the exterior navmesh completly yet. But there is enough place for some followers
to move and use the workplace or sit at the campfire. The shack itself is follower friendly !

On my own, into the wilds, surviving. So, feel invited to do the same with your next game !

P.S. Feel free to post a lot of screenshots :)
P.S.S. Since many ask what ENB I´m using: jasminENB and I´ve added mainly saturation via the IMAGINATOR mod. For this mod, I also made my custom colored light for fire and daylight.
author: SecondSight
